result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Koller J Stettler

records.addlTxt: Motion for Leave to File Additional Motions

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Koller J Stettler not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA TenHaken.  Attorney Erika L Bierma appeared by phone for Koller J Stettler. Called @ 3:57 pm. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status conference on both files - 22CM323 and 22CM198. Court waived the defendant's appearance for today and allowed Atty. Bierma to appear by phone. Record by Atty. that she has not filed her discovery demand yet, but will get that done forthwith. Asks for status about 90 days out. Court grants but attorney and defendant must appear in person.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Koller J Stettler in court.  Attorney Erika L Bierma not in court.
Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. 
Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Koller J Stettler in court.  Attorney Erika L Bierma in court for Koller J Stettler. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered by court and trial reserved. Defendant stands mute. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 196485,
Payable Number: 265292,
Receipt Number: 22R 011913,
Amount: $20.00
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CM323 & 22CM198

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.V.L. dob 8-13-1983 OR RESIDENCE, EXCEPT FOR AS PROVIDED BY INJUNCTION - 21CV640. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
